title: Total synthesis of marine antitumor agents trabectedin and lurbinectedin

title_detail.value: Total synthesis of marine antitumor agents trabectedin and lurbinectedin

summary: With its vast numbers of different lifeforms, the sea is a largely unexplored source of natural products that could be starting points for new pharmaceuticals, such as the antitumor drugs trabectedin and lurbinectedin. Because only tiny amounts can be obtained from sea organisms, synthetic production is necessary. Scientists have introduced a new, efficient synthetic route for these two drugs. A key step is the light-controlled activation of a carbon-hydrogen bond.
